words.definition: Avail is help. It is often used in the achievement of a goal.
words.example: His studying was to no avail because he failed the test.

words.definition: To expand is to become bigger in size.
words.example: A balloon will expand as you blow air into it.

words.definition: To define means to clearly state, show, or explain what something is.
words.example: People define success in many different ways.

words.definition: To dread is to be afraid of something that could, or is going to, happen.
words.example: I dread the idea that I will not get into college.

words.definition: If something is fundamental, it is a basic part of something.
words.example: The fundamental rules of the game are quite simple.

words.definition: If something is horrifying, it is extremely scary or shocking.
words.example: The news of the accident was horrifying.

words.definition: If you are incredulous, you do not believe something.
words.example: He was incredulous when he heard he had won the lottery.

words.definition: To linger is to stay somewhere longer than necessary.
words.example: The smell of fresh bread lingered in the kitchen.

words.definition: An organism is a living thing, such as a plant or animal.
words.example: The scientist studied the tiny organism under a microscope.

words.definition: To paraphrase is to express something in different words.
words.example: The student paraphrased the teacher's explanation.

words.definition: A plague is a serious disease that spreads quickly.
words.example: The plague killed many people in the Middle Ages.

words.definition: Presently means happening now or in a short time.
words.example: He is presently working on a new book.

words.definition: If something is random, it happens without a specific plan.
words.example: The numbers were chosen in a random order.

words.definition: A riot is a violent protest by a group of people.
words.example: A riot broke out in the city after the football match.

words.definition: To scribble is to write something quickly and messily.
words.example: He scribbled a note and left it on the table.

words.definition: A shrine is a holy place where people go to pray.
words.example: Many people visit the shrine to show their respect.

words.definition: Solitude is the state of being alone.
words.example: He enjoys the solitude of the mountains.

words.definition: If something is stark, it is very plain or distinct.
words.example: The white house stood in stark contrast to the black trees.

words.definition: To summon is to officially ask someone to come.
words.example: The king summoned his advisors to the palace.

words.definition: To worsen is to become worse or more serious.
words.example: The weather began to worsen as the sun went down.
